John McCain told ABC television: I respect secretary Donald Rumsfeld . He and I had a very, very strong difference of opinion about the strategy he was employing in Iraq, which I predicted was doomed to failure. Thank God he was relieved of his duties and we put the surge in. Otherwise we would have had a disastrous defeat in Iraq. Middle East would be "far more perilous than it is today" if Saddam Hussein had remained in power. He denies he made a mistake in not sending a bigger US force to Iraq in 2003.
